intro: Mitracarpus anthospermoides, commonly known as the golden balm, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, spicy scent. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
